TopicTitle: The KSP Community My Little Pony Megathread

Articles.Content: Xbox not PC sorry but you can still see the details somewhat.

The only thing im really sad about is that i am twelve. When im old enough to have my own house and car, MLP will most likely be ending. That means that bronyism will come to an end too( Obviously not as soon as the show ended, but a time after that). So no more conventions, shirts, swag, and ponies

I put dash\'s cutie mark sticker on the back of my pickup\'s window.

It looks pretty cool but it isn\'t obvious to people that haven\'t seen the show.

I love how it\'s just 'a little weird' that my younger sister is obsessed with Transformers (read: she knows every one by name, and constantly checks our local Walmart for new ones), yet when I enjoy just watching this show, I\'m instantly considered insane.

I love how it\'s just 'a little weird' that my younger sister is obsessed with Transformers (read: she knows every one by name, and constantly checks our local Walmart for new ones), yet when I enjoy just watching this show, I\'m instantly considered insane.

Yes, society is sexist. Not against men in particular - the girly show isn\'t 'good enough' for men to watch, while the manly Transformers boom explosions yeah is fine for girls.
So much season 3 news on EQD. Im drooling. Some season 3 songs are revealed and a duet with Octavia and Rarity, a fluttershy dragon (I have no idea) and moar Trixie. So excited /)^3^(\

just sing out loud in front of them all about how your a bro-knee then throw a party and have a fashion show and invite all your woodland animal friends to join you and maby have a tea party...DONT FORGET YOUR PARTY CANNON

Isn\'t it essentially equal to saying you like, say, Top Gear?

'Hey, friends! I like Top Gear!'

Actually, it\'d be more like saying you like Top Gear USA...

Well i found another brony in the process, so mission accomplished.

EDIT: Seems nobody has commented on my posts. Think im a freak or? I dunno whatever.

Well i found another brony in the process, so mission accomplished.

No. They probably just don\'t care. It probably won\'t strike them as unusual - different people like different things. Just like how I like finding out interesting things about the people my friends love (eg. Names).
